messages.title: THE LIB DEMS ARE WINNING
messages.content:
Support for the Lib Dems has continued to grow following their stunning success at the local and European elections in May.

Recent polls show support for the Liberal Democrats is now at record levels and Jo Swinson is the most popular party leader.

MPs from Labour and the Conservatives are joining the Lib Dems, fed up with the broken politics the two old parties represent.

messages.title: OUR PLAN FOR BRITAIN’S FUTURE
messages.content:
Stop Brexit: Stop Brexit and invest the £50 billion Remain Bonus in public services and tackling inequality.

Tackle the climate emergency: Tackle the climate emergency by generating 80% of our electricity from renewable energy and insulate all low-income homes by 2025.

Build a fairer economy: Build a fairer economy by providing free childcare from 9 months and giving every adult £10,000 to spend on skills & training throughout their lives.

Transform our mental health services: Transform our mental health services by treating mental health with the same urgency as physical health.

Give every child the best start in life: Give every child the best start in life by recruiting 20,000 more teachers as part of an extra £10 billion a year for schools.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stop Brexit and invest the £50 billion Remain Bonus in public services and tackling inequality.
Tackle the climate emergency by generating 80% of our electricity from renewable energy and insulate all low-income homes by 2025.
Build a fairer economy by providing free childcare from 9 months and giving every adult £10,000 to spend on skills & training throughout their lives.
Transform our mental health services by treating mental health with the same urgency as physical health.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Give every child the best start in life
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Give every child the best start in life by recruiting 20,000 more teachers as part of an extra £10 billion a year for schools.

mentions.candidate: Richard Morris: a strong local voice for Tonbridge and Malling
mentions.tacticalSituation: Recent polls show support for the Liberal Democrats is now at record levels and Jo Swinson is the most popular party leader.

issues.brexitEurope: Stop Brexit and invest the £50 billion Remain Bonus in public services and tackling inequality. End Brexit.
issues.economy: Build a fairer economy by providing free childcare from 9 months and giving every adult £10,000 to spend on skills & training throughout their lives.
issues.education: Give every child the best start in life by recruiting 20,000 more teachers as part of an extra £10 billion a year for schools.
issues.environment: Tackle the climate emergency by generating 80% of our electricity from renewable energy and insulate all low-income homes by 2025.
issues.health: Transform our mental health services by treating mental health with the same urgency as physical health.

community.content: Protect our global and local environment. Develop local transport networks. Ensure our schools and hospitals are properly funded. Protect our local and national economy. Stand up for the rights of all constituents.

leaflet.personalStatement:
I have lived in Tonbridge and Malling for over 30 years. My priorities for our constituency reflect this commitment:

End Brexit.
Protect our global and local environment. Develop our local transport networks.
Ensure our schools and hospitals are properly funded. Protect our local and national economy. Stand up for the rights of all constituents.

politicalExperience.achievements: I served as a trustee of Kent Opera and Kent Music, and on the board of Invicta Radio. I am on the committee of Tonbridge in Europe as well as the National Executive of The European Movement.

examples: Recent polls show support for the Liberal Democrats is now at record levels and Jo Swinson is the most popular party leader.
Protect our global and local environment.

nonPolicyAttributes.employment: Having worked as a lawyer, banker, publisher and CEO I have a range of real-world skills.
